page.title: 10LOCAL SHOPPING IN GREENFORD
page.content: Present trends in shopping seem to show a preference for superstores, many small shops have been hit. Is this so here? Shoppers questioned lived within walking distance of local shops. 45% shopped many times a week, doing most of their weekly shopping there. 63% said the shops did cater for most basic needs bar clothes. 52% stated costs, usually higher than in larger shopping areas were offset by saved time and travel costs. 60% thought perishable goods were less than fresh; choice was limited. All felt shops needed renovation. Shopkeepers admitted the bulk of their customers were elderly, spending the bare minimum; young mothers avoiding public transport and others purchasing quickly on the way home from work. Trade was fairly brisk between 9am and 10.30 am.
